items.todoItem: Know that Paul’s mission for God was to the Gentiles.
Take note that Paul’s imprisonment because of Jesus did not prevent his ministry to the Gentiles.
Know that Paul was given the provision of God’s grace for the stewardship and benefit of the Gentiles.
Know that when God chooses to use people to achieve His purpose, He also equips them.
Know that God shares knowledge of His plans by revelation.
Know that God made His plans for the Messiah known to Paul by revelation.
Know that God decides at what moment in history and to whom revelation of His plans for the Messiah are given.
Know that God sees His apostles and prophets as holy.
Know that revelation comes by the Holy Spirit.
Know that the hidden secret has been revealed: the gospel enables the Gentiles to join the body of Christ and to become fellow heirs and partakers of God’s promise in Christ.
Know that Paul was made a minister of the gospel by God and did not choose this honour for himself.
Know that it was God’s continual gift of grace that Paul said enabled him to minister the gospel with miraculous power to the Gentiles.
Know that, even though Paul considered himself less than the least of all saints, God still chose to equip and use Paul mightily.
Know, that like Paul, each and every saint has an equally important and unique part to play in God’s plan and purpose.
Know that it is the grace of God that Paul said gave him his ability to preach the immense riches of Christ to the Gentiles.
Know that there are incomprehensible and abundant riches to be found in Christ.
Know that it was God’s hidden plan from the very beginning to unite Jews and Gentiles in fellowship in the body of Christ by the gospel.
Know that God chooses to reveal His plans to whom He will and only when He is ready to do so.
Know that God created all things by Jesus Christ.
Know that it was always God’s plan to make His manifold wisdom known to those in heavenly places through the revelation given to His church at this moment in history.
Know that God’s eternal plan involved Jesus Christ our Lord from the very beginning.
Know that God has positioned His Son Jesus Christ at the centre of His plans for all eternity.
Know that our faith in Christ gives boldness and direct access to the Father who we may approach with confidence.
Don’t be exhausted by the tribulations of others for your benefit but rather glory in it.
Know that Paul endured tribulations for his ministry to the Gentiles.
Follow Paul’s example of how he honours and reverences God by kneeling to pray.
Bend your knees and pray to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Know that the whole family in heaven and earth is named after Jesus Christ.
Pray in accordance with the abundant riches of His glory that God would strengthen you with miraculous power by His Spirit which dwells within you.
Pray that Christ may dwell at the centre of your life by faith.
Pray that you may be firmly rooted and grounded in God’s unconditional love.
Pray that you and your Christian brethren may be able to fully understand the whole mystery of God’s plan.
Know that the unconditional love of Christ surpasses all knowledge.
Pray to know the love of Christ and be filled with all the abundance of God.
Know that God is able to do abundantly more than we ask or think through His miraculous power that works in us.
Know that God’s Holy Spirit is at work within us.
Let every generation give glory to God in the church by Christ Jesus forever.
Take note that Paul prays for those to whom he is ministering.
